location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:155 x 205 mmFormat:1 b&w silver gelatin printCondition:The image is in good condition with minimal fading.Process:Gelatin silver print

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This aerial view of the Beni Bu Ali Fort looking west on 4 February 1932 by the R.A.F. during a reconnaissance mission in advance of a planned bombardment of Aiqa and Jaalan (Ja‘alān) described in following folios, f. 129-130.The fort is at centre and surrounding dwellings and enclosures extend from right to left, while a large number of enclosed plantations can also be seen in the background and right and left.The inscriptions in the upper right corner probably refer to camera settings, as well as date and time of capture.Inscriptions:Recto, directly into negative, upper right corner: 203.B.357.P BENI-BU-ALI-FORT 4.2.32.1010 F6" 4000' LOOKING W.’Temporal Context:Prints produced on 18 February 1932. Photographs taken on 4 February 1932, likely at 10.10 am.
